The Smokey Dokey is a classic beef cheese burger topped with thick, crispy, crunchy onion rings, melted mortadella cheese and a dollop of an inhouse smokey sauce. This one turns out to be a textural and flavour bonanza; the onion rings provide some sweetness and crunch, the beef some chew, and the cheese and smokey sauce with the much-needed additional zing.  The Smashroom is one for mushroom lovers, as the classic juicy beef cheeseburger is topped with caramelized onions, loads of delicious mushroom chunks and a creamy, peppery mushroom sauce.  The third burger we tried was the Fiery Sriracha: a juicy cheeseburger, topped with caramelized onions and what was supposed to be a “fiery” sriracha sauce. So, the burger was obviously good, but it was expected to be spicy and set the taste buds ablaze, but nothing of that sort happened. In fact, the sauce was borderline bland, which just kind of killed the overall burger; it was akin to eating a plain, classic beef burger.  The burgers are a satisfying gastronomic adventure, full of texture and flavour. What’s also exciting about these burgers is that they all let the juicy, tender minced smash beef – sandwiched between buttery brioche buns -- stand out despite the toppings and accompaniments; you can taste the meat and all other ingredients in all their individual glory. And the burgers also come in double patties for those who want an extra dose of protein. We also tried their beef and chicken loaded fries, each topped generously with chicken fillet or minced, smash beef chunks, jalapenos, melted mortadella cheese, and a mix of sauces. Their serving size easily makes them a meal on their own, also priced quite reasonably at Rs599 (chicken) and Rs699 (beef).  Their shakes are a highlight of the menu: in lotus, brownie, thick chocolate, peanut butter and banana, salt caramel flavour. They're the perfect accompaniment or even a top-off to a meal. The best part about Melt is that you can catch it in the middle of the night too to satisfy any midnight snack cravings, as they’re open till 3:30am on weekends and 3am on weekdays. But they have to step up their game, because orders take too long if you don't remind them several times.

Title: Karachi starts growing world's priciest 'Miyazaki' Mango
Content: The cultivation of the world's most expensive mango, the 'Miyazaki', has recently begun in Karachi, marking a major milestone in the agricultural landscape of Pakistan. Previously grown exclusively in Japan, this prized fruit now finds a new home in Pakistan's commercial hub. The 'Miyazaki' mango, renowned for its unique red and purple hues, is a high-value fruit fetching prices between $800 and $900 per kilogram in the international market, translating to approximately Rs250,000 to Rs300,000. Locally, the price of this luxurious mango can soar to Rs3 lakh per kg, making it a rare and elite commodity not easily accessible to the common consumer. Pakistan is already famous for its diverse and flavorful mango varieties such as Chaunsa, Sindhri, Langra, Dasheri, and Anwar Ratol.  Each of these varieties holds a special place in the global market for their unique tastes. The introduction of 'Miyazaki' mangoes adds a new dimension to Pakistan's mango production, potentially elevating the country's status in the international fruit market. A local farmer, who has successfully cultivated the 'Miyazaki' mango in Karachi, shared insights with Samaa TV's Special Correspondent. He emphasized the distinct characteristics of the 'Miyazaki' mango, noting its exceptional color, taste, and value. Although typically yellow, this mango stands out for its rare red and purple appearance. The farmer revealed that the cultivation process started on a trial basis, and the initial results have been promising. With the successful adaptation of the 'Miyazaki' mango to Karachi's climate, there is potential for broader commercial cultivation, which could revolutionize the local agricultural economy.

Title: PM, CJP turn out to be fans of Karachi food
Content: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Chief Justice of Pakistan Qazi Faez Isa have expressed their fondness for the food available in Karachi during their separate engagements in the city. Addressing businessmen in the port city on Wednesday, Prime Minister Sharif urged them to show Pakistan's rich culinary heritage to a large investors' delegation arriving from Saudi Arabia soon. He asked the businessmen to introduce them to local delicacies such as nihari and kababs and work together to strengthen business ties through gastronomic diplomacy. Also Read: Arif Habib urges PM Shehbaz to extend olive branch to imprisoned Imran Khan Meanwhile, at a luncheon hosted by the Supreme Court Bar Association in Karachi on the same day, Chief Justice Isa reminisced about his memories associated with the city. He recalled how he still remembers the flavours of Karachi's food and how affordable the food used to be. "Coming to Karachi has brought back some old memories," he remarked, recalling how good the food used to be back then. The CJP fondly remembered the time when a kachori was available for just a rupee.

Title: Vada pav ranks among world's best sandwiches
Content: Vada pav, the beloved Mumbai street food delicacy, has garnered international recognition by securing a spot on the prestigious list of the world's best sandwiches. According to the latest rankings released by TasteAtlas, a renowned food and travel guide platform, vada pav has claimed the 19th position among the top sandwiches for March 2024, alongside globally acclaimed favourites such as shawarma, reuben, and lobster rolls. A post shared by TasteAtlas (@tasteatlas)  The coveted first place on the list has been awarded to Banh mi, a Vietnamese culinary delight. Top 10 Best Sandwiches In the World: TasteAtlas describes the dish as, “This iconic street food is said to have originated from a street vendor named Ashok Vaidya. He thought of a way to satiate hungry workers, and concluded the ideal dish should be portable, affordable, and easy to prepare.”

Title: Ramazan 2024: Which countries have longest fasting hours?
Content: More than a billion Muslims fast in the morning hours during the holy month of Ramazan. Every year, the holy month begins around two weeks early. This year, it will pass from the longer, hotter summer days to the shorter, colder winter days for half of the planet. Ramazan started on March 11 with fasting hours varying across different countries. The fasting hours range between 12 hours and more than 17 hours. So which countries have the shortest and the longest Ramazan, especially in the Muslim world? Shortest Ramazan fast in 2024: Muslims in Chile will face the shortest Ramazan with almost 12 hours and 44 minutes of fasting. New Zealand, Argentina and South Africa being in the Southern Hemisphere also look at a shorter fasting time between 12 to 13 hours. Longest Ramazan fast: In Europe, Muslims of Finland, Iceland and Greenland will face 17 longest fasting hours during the holy month. How to observe Ramazan where it never gets dark: Although no location is anticipating a midnight sun in Ramazan, Muslims in nations where the days are especially long during the holy month are unable to observe a fast of more than 20 hours. As the daylight varies depending on the season, fasting in the countries further from the equator tends to be longer. So what do they do? Fatwas have been proclaimed in nations where the time difference between sunset and sunrise is less than three hours, enabling citizens to observe other cities' schedules. For instance, a lot of people would observe Makkah's fasting hours in Saudi Arabia. This year the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and almost the whole Middle East will observe about 13.5 to 14 hours of fasting. African country Tunisia will face the longest fasting hours of Ramazan at 14 hours and 29 minutes. Ramazan fasting durations across the Arab world: Tunisia: The longest day was 14 hours and 29 minutes, while the shortest was 13 hours and 17 minutes. Algeria: 14 hours and 27 minutes is the longest day, while 13 hours and 14 minutes is the shortest. Libya: 13 hours and 18 minutes is the shortest day, while 14 hours and 20 minutes is the longest. Morocco: 14 hours and 12 minutes is the longest day, while 13 hours and 12 minutes is the shortest. Egypt: 14 hours and 34 minutes is the longest day, while the shortest is 13 hours and 17 minutes. Iraq: 14 hours and 18 minutes is the longest day, while 13 hours and 13 minutes is the shortest. Bahrain: The longest day is 14 hours, while the shortest is 13 hours and 13 minutes. UAE: 13 hours and 12 minutes is the shortest day, while 13 hours and 57 minutes is the longest. Saudi Arabia: 13 hours and 13 minutes is the shortest day, while 13 hours and 56 minutes is the longest. Oman: 13 hours and 13 minutes is the shortest day, while 13 hours and 54 minutes is the longest. Kuwait: 14 hours and 8 minutes is the longest day, while 13 hours and 14 minutes is the shortest. Lebanon: 13 hours and 12 minutes is the shortest day, while 14 hours and 17 minutes is the longest. Jordan: 13 hours and 12 minutes is the shortest day, while 14 hours and 15 minutes is the longest. Palestine: 13 hours and 10 minutes is the shortest day, while 14 hours and 11 minutes is the longest. Syria: 14 hours and 19 minutes is the longest day, while 13 hours and 13 minutes is the shortest. Qatar: 13 hours and 13 minutes is the shortest day, while 13 hours and 59 minutes is the longest. Mauretania: The shortest fasting day almost consists of 13 hours and 10 minutes, while the longest day is 13 hours and 42 minutes. Sudan: 13 hours and 16 minutes is the shortest day, while 13 hours and 43 minutes is the longest. Yemen: 13 hours and 13 minutes is the shortest day, while 13 hours and 39 minutes is the longest. Somalia: 13 hours and 15 minutes is the shortest day, while 13 hours and 18 minutes is the longest. Djibouti: 13 hours and 11 minutes is the shortest day, while 13 hours and 31 minutes is the longest. Comoros: 13 hours and 18 minutes is the shortest day, while 13 hours and 23 minutes is the longest.

Title: Most powerful passports 2024: Find out Pakistan's position
Content: For the fourth consecutive year, the Pakistani passport has been ranked as the fourth worst on this year's Henley Passport Index, which evaluates the world’s 199 passports based on the number of destinations their holders can visit without needing a prior visa. According to the latest rankings released on Tuesday, Pakistan’s passport is positioned at 100th place, tied with Yemen. It is only ranked above those of Iraq (101st), Syria (102nd), and Afghanistan (103rd), maintaining the same position as last year.  Pakistani and Yemeni passports grant visa-free access to 33 countries. In comparison, Iraqi passports allow travel to 31 destinations, Syrian passports offer access to 28 countries, and Afghan passports provide entry to just 26 destinations. “Afghanistan remains firmly entrenched as the world’s weakest passport, losing access to yet another destination over the past six months, leaving its citizens with access to only 26 countries visa-free — the lowest score ever recorded in history of the 19-year-old index,” a press release said. At the top of the rankings, Singapore’s passport continues to hold the top spot, granting visa-free entry to 195 destinations, setting a new record. Germany, Italy, Japan, France, and Spain are tied for second place, each allowing access to 192 destinations. Austria, Finland, Ireland, Luxembourg, Netherlands, South Korea, and Sweden share the third position with 191 destinations. The United Kingdom is ranked 4th, along with Belgium, Denmark, New Zealand, Norway, and Switzerland, all offering access to 190 countries. The United States is in 8th place, with access to 186 destinations. Notably, the United Arab Emirates has entered the top 10 for the first time, with its passport now offering visa-free access to 185 destinations. This marks a significant rise from its previous 62nd position to 9th, reflecting an impressive increase of 53 places. The press release quoted Henley & Partners CEO Dr Juerg Steffen as saying that the UAE’s “meteoric ascent” was the result of “deliberate and concerted efforts by the Emirati government to position the UAE as a global hub for business, tourism, and investment. “Our research has consistently shown a strong correlation between a country’s visa-free score and its economic prosperity. Nations with higher visa-free scores tend to enjoy greater GDP per capita, increased foreign direct investment and more robust international trade relationships.”

Title: Is Pakistan among the 93 countries granted visa-free access to Thailand?
Content: In a major boost to its tourism industry, Thailand has announced visa-free entry for citizens of 93 countries. This exciting new policy, which took effect immediately, allows visitors from these countries to stay in the "Land of Smiles" for up to 60 days without the hassle of securing a visa. Previously, only passport holders from 57 countries enjoyed this privilege. This significant expansion is expected to attract millions of tourists and revitalize Thailand's economy, which heavily relies on tourism. Who benefits? The visa-free scheme covers a wide range of countries, including popular tourist destinations like the United States, United Kingdom, Australia, and Canada, as well as emerging markets such as India, China, and Brazil. However, it's important to note that Pakistanis are not currently included in this list. Thailand’s tourism boom Thailand’s tourism sector has been steadily recovering from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. The country recorded a remarkable 17.5 million foreign visitors in the first half of this year, marking a 35% increase compared to the same period in 2023. This surge in tourist arrivals is a testament to Thailand's enduring appeal as a top travel destination. Other visa-related changes In addition to the visa-free policy, Thailand has introduced a five-year visa for foreign workers, allowing them to stay for up to 180 days per year. Furthermore, international students with bachelor's degrees or higher can now stay in the country for a year after graduation to explore job opportunities or travel plans. These changes reflect Thailand's commitment to attracting skilled workers and talented graduates while fostering a vibrant and welcoming environment for visitors from around the world. While Pakistanis eagerly await the possibility of visa-free travel to Thailand, the country continues to explore new avenues to enhance its tourism potential and strengthen its global connections.

Title: Air tickets get more expensive after tax hike
Content: In the latest budget for 2024-25, air travel costs are set to rise massively, particularly for those flying in business and club class. Starting from July 1, the government has introduced new excise duties on air tickets to various international destinations. These changes take effect on July 1st and will be felt most by travelers heading to destinations like the United States, Canada, North and Latin America. The excise duty for these routes has jumped significantly, from Rs 250,000 to Rs 350,000. That's a cool Rs 100,000 extra you’ll need to shell out for that premium flying experience. Europe isn’t spared either. Business class flights to European countries will now come with a Rs 210,000 duty, up from the previous Rs 150,000. This represents a Rs 60,000 increase for those hoping to explore European destinations in style.  Travelers to New Zealand and Australia will also face a similar Rs 60,000 duty hike, bringing the total to Rs 210,000. And it’s not just long-haul trips that are affected. The duty on business class tickets to popular Asian destinations like China, Malaysia, and Indonesia has also been raised to Rs 210,000. Meanwhile, travelers to Saudi Arabia, UAE, the Middle East, and African countries will now pay an additional Rs 30,000, with the new excise duty totaling Rs 105,000. These changes reflect the government’s strategy to increase revenue through higher taxes on luxury travel options.

Title: Australia reinstates TOEFL scores for visa applications
Content: The Australian Department of Home Affairs (DHA) has announced the lifting of its temporary suspension on accepting TOEFL scores for visa applications. This decision allows applicants to once again use the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT test results to demonstrate their English language proficiency. Last July, the DHA temporarily halted the acceptance of TOEFL scores to conduct a thorough review. After careful consideration, TOEFL scores are now recognized as valid documentation for visa applications, effective immediately. The TOEFL is a standardized test designed to assess the English language skills of non-native speakers. It is widely accepted by universities and institutions worldwide, including those in Australia. Australian immigration requires applicants to demonstrate a certain level of English proficiency to ensure effective communication and integration into Australian life. Submitting a TOEFL score is one way to meet this requirement and strengthen a visa application. The DHA reinstated the acceptance of TOEFL scores for visa applications on May 5, 2024. Only TOEFL iBT scores obtained on or after this date will be considered valid. Australia also recognizes scores from other established English proficiency exams, such as the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE), Cambridge English (CAE), and Occupational English Test (OET) for healthcare professionals. The resumption of TOEFL acceptance streamlines visa procedures, making it easier for international students, professionals, and migrants to pursue opportunities in Australia. By embracing various recognized English proficiency tests, Australia reaffirms its commitment to diversity and inclusion, inviting individuals from around the world to contribute to its education system and cultural richness.

Title: New regulations for work permit issuance approved in Kuwait
Content: In response to labour shortages and rising costs, Kuwait has introduced significant changes to its labor permit system. The Kuwaiti Public Authority of Manpower (PAM) has approved amendments aimed at tackling the labor shortage effectively. One major change is the removal of the requirement for employers to relocate existing workers within Kuwait before hiring from abroad. This adjustment aims to streamline the hiring process and foster business development. Additionally, new regulations include a revised fee structure for work permits. Initially, employees will be charged KD 150 for a work permit, with an extra KD 300 for transferring workers between companies within the first three years of employment. These reforms seek to create a more sustainable economic environment by curbing illegal visa trading, stabilizing the labor market, and reducing labor costs. Given that expatriates make up a significant portion of Kuwait's population, estimated at 3.2 million out of 4.8 million, these changes will profoundly impact the country's labor market and economic landscape.

Title: World Photography Day: Picturesque places, history, and significance
Content: Photography, is a medium that has the ability to freeze moments in time, stir emotions, and ignite conversations. In an age dominated by visual media, where a single image can tell a story more powerfully than a thousand words, photography stands as a timeless art form. On August 19th every year, the world comes together to celebrate World Photography Day, an occasion that pays tribute to the art, science, and history of photography. The day honors the invaluable contributions of photographers and acknowledges the magic of freezing moments in time with the click of a button. In a world filled with fleeting moments, a photograph has the power to make time stand still and to tell a story that will be remembered for generations to come. Photographs can convey the human experience in its full spectrum of emotions: joy, sorrow, love, and anger. A single photograph has the power to inspire, educate, and drive change. Historically, photographs have played a pivotal role in documenting important events and shaping public opinion. Iconic images like “Migrant Mother” by Dorothea Lange during the Great Depression or “Tank Man” during the Tiananmen Square protests serve as powerful reminders of the enduring impact that a well-composed photograph can have on society. Pakistan, with its rich culture, diverse landscapes, and historical landmarks, offers a treasure trove of photographic opportunities. Let’s have a glimpse of some picturesque places in Lahore and Islamabad, Pakistan, where your camera lens can work its magic. Picturesque places in Lahore Badshahi Mosque   This architectural marvel, built during the Mughal era, stands as a testament to the grandeur of the past. The intricate details and vast courtyards make it a perfect subject for photography. Shalimar Gardens   These stunning Mughal gardens are a symphony of fountains, water channels, and lush greenery. Capture the reflection of the gardens in the flowing water for a breathtaking shot. Picturesque places in Islamabad Faisal Mosque   As one of the largest mosques in the world, the Faisal Mosque offers a modern architectural marvel against the backdrop of the Margalla Hills. The play of light during different times of the day adds to its photographic charm. Rawal Lake  This serene lake, nestled in the Margalla Hills, provides a tranquil setting for nature photography. The reflection of the hills on the calm waters is a sight to behold. Lok Virsa Museum   Explore the rich cultural heritage of Pakistan through photography. The museum’s exhibits showcase traditional crafts, art, and artifacts. World Photography Day is not just a day to commemorate the invention of photography; it’s a celebration of the visual language that transcends borders and connects people worldwide. Photography has a unique ability to tell stories, evoke emotions, and shed light on important issues. It’s a medium that captures the essence of a moment, preserving it for generations to come. The significance of this day lies in its power to inspire and educate. World Photography Day is observed on August 19th to mark the day in 1839 when the French government announced the invention of the daguerreotype, a photographic process developed by Louis Daguerre. This invention, which followed the pioneering work of Nicéphore Niépce, revolutionized the way we capture images. The daguerreotype process reduced exposure times, making it practical for the first time to capture portraits and scenes from daily life. Over the years, photography has evolved from cumbersome, time-consuming processes to the digital age we live in today. In the 19th century, it was a novelty, and today, it’s an integral part of our daily lives.

Title: Female teacher turns trash into treasure, embarks on entrepreneurial journey
Content: In a remarkable transformation of passion and purpose, Nadia Qureshi, a dedicated female teacher from Peshawar, has embarked on a pioneering entrepreneurial journey by turning “trash into treasure”. Her innovative approach to upcycling household waste is not only reducing environmental impact but also creating opportunities for economic empowerment within her community. In a world grappling with the urgent need to address climate change and revitalize economies, the story of Nadia Qureshi, a dedicated teacher turned innovative entrepreneur, shines as a beacon of hope. Hailing from the bustling city of Peshawar, Nadia’s mission is as simple as it is transformative: to convert household waste into stunning decorative items while empowering women along the way. “People underestimate the potential of what they consider waste,” Nadia explains. “Through simple techniques and a bit of imagination, we can turn trash into valuable art”. “I believe that every small action counts,” Nadia states. “By making environmentally responsible choices, we can collectively make a significant impact on our planet”. “My goal is not only to create beautiful art but also to empower women to realize their potential,” Nadia explains. “When women are financially empowered, they can contribute significantly to their families and communities.”  With a background in teaching, she was well aware of the urgent need to address the global waste crisis. Motivated by a desire to make a tangible impact, Nadia began to experiment with turning everyday household waste items into beautiful and functional pieces of art. What started as a personal passion project soon blossomed into a full-fledged eco-friendly business venture. Nadia’s creative journey involves repurposing a wide range of items often considered waste, such as plastic bottles, newspapers, cardboard, and discarded electronics. Recognizing the challenges faced by many in her community, she has made it a mission to offer training and employment opportunities to local women. Her workshop has become a hub for skill development and economic independence. By teaching women the art of upcycling, she is not only fostering creativity but also providing them with a source of income, which can be pivotal in their families’ financial well-being.

Title: Creative ideas to decorate your empty walls
Content: Blank walls in your home are like a canvas waiting to be painted with your personality and style. While there are countless ways to decorate these blank spaces, the key lies in finding ideas that resonate with your taste and elevate the ambiance of your living space. Decorating your blank walls is an opportunity to infuse your home with your personality and creativity. Whether you opt for a gallery wall, nature-inspired decor, mirrors, unique shelving, or fiber art, each idea has the potential to astonish and transform your living space. The key is to embrace what resonates with you and turn your blank canvases into captivating expressions of your style and identity. In this article, we’ll explore five astonishing ideas to turn your empty walls into captivating focal points. Gallery wall extravaganza   One of the most timeless and versatile ways to adorn your walls is by creating a gallery wall. This artful arrangement can be tailored to your preferences, featuring a mix of artwork, photographs, and decorative objects. To add a touch of cohesion, frame your chosen pieces in a uniform color or style. The key is to strike a balance between symmetry and asymmetry, allowing your unique style to shine through. Consider incorporating a diverse array of items, such as vintage posters, family portraits, and quirky finds from your travels. For added flair, experiment with different frame sizes and shapes. The result will be a captivating visual journey that tells a story of your life and interests. Nature’s wall art   Bring the outdoors inside by embracing the beauty of nature as wall decor. Botanical prints, pressed flowers, or even a living plant wall can infuse your space with a sense of tranquility and natural elegance. For a simple yet astonishing touch, frame dried leaves or pressed flowers between glass panes. Alternatively, opt for larger botanical prints or posters showcasing the intricacies of leaves and flowers. Consider a vertical garden, using succulents or air plants in wall-mounted containers to create a striking living wall that requires minimal maintenance. Mirror on the wall   Mirrors are not just for vanity; they can also be a powerful decorative tool. Strategically placed mirrors can make a room appear larger and reflect light, creating an illusion of spaciousness and brightness. Consider incorporating a unique mirror with an ornate frame as a statement piece, or experiment with an arrangement of smaller mirrors in various shapes and sizes to add depth and dimension to your wall. To enhance the effect, position mirrors across from windows or other light sources to maximize the play of light. Wall-mounted shelving with a twist   Functional and stylish, wall-mounted shelves offer endless possibilities for wall decor. To add an astonishing twist, choose unconventional shelving materials and shapes. Consider installing floating wooden shelves to display a curated selection of books, art objects, and plants. Alternatively, opt for asymmetrical or geometric shelving units that serve as both storage and art. The key is to balance form and function, creating an aesthetically pleasing yet practical design element. Fiber art and tapestries   The resurgence of fiber art and tapestries offers a unique way to add texture and warmth to your walls. These handmade pieces can be customized to match your color scheme and design preferences. Choose a striking macramé wall hanging as a statement piece, or opt for a large, intricately woven tapestry that covers a substantial portion of your wall. These handmade artworks can add a touch of bohemian chic or contemporary elegance to your space, depending on your choice of design and material.

Title: ‘Kabhi Main Kabhi Tum’ star Hania Aamir laughs off wedding plans
Content: Renowned Pakistani actress Hania Aamir recently addressed one of her fans’ most pressing questions — “When are you getting married?” — during a fan event in Canada. The actress, currently on an international tour, made it clear that her wedding plans are not in the works, at least for the time being. Responding to the query with her signature wit, Hania laughed and said, “No plans yet!” She went on to humorously assure her fans, “I’m just a simple girl — when I do decide to get married, trust me, I’ll be the first to announce it to everyone!” The fan event, which saw the actress engaging with fans on a wide range of topics, provided a glimpse into Hania’s cheerful and down-to-earth personality. One moment that particularly resonated with the audience was when she shared her thoughts on connections beyond borders. Reflecting on the power of admiration and human connection, she said, “Borders can’t keep hearts apart. If you admire someone, no wall can stop that.” Hania also expressed her joy in meeting her international fans, adding, “Traveling internationally allows me to connect with all of you, and meeting you brings me so much joy.”

Title: Mehwish Hayat and Honey Singh dazzle fans in ‘Jatt Mehkma’ music video
Content: Mehwish Hayat and Honey Singh’s highly anticipated collaboration, Jatt Mehkma, has finally been released, amassing impressive views and engagement in its first 24 hours. The video, part of Singh’s newly launched album Glory, showcases Hayat in a mobster-inspired role alongside Singh, both exuding undeniable chemistry and charisma. The video opens with an elegant party scene, where well-dressed guests mingle before turning their attention to Hayat and Singh, the night’s focal points. Mehwish Hayat, embodying the role of a mobster’s significant other, captivates in an off-shoulder black outfit paired with a pearl necklace and matching heels, while Singh complements her look in a sleek suit and oversized coat. Hints of the collaboration began circulating in October when both stars posted a short teaser, with Hayat captioning the post “Karampura Karachi connection baby. Something exclusive with the one and only Mehwish Hayat.” Fans speculated eagerly about the release, which marks Hayat’s first venture into a project with Singh. Jatt Mehkma is the second track on Glory, Singh’s 18-track album, described as a “home-grown international” project that also includes Pakistani artists Wahab Bugti and Sahiban.

Title: Ajoka Dosti International Theatre Festival begins in Lahore
Content: The Ajoka Dosti International Theatre Festival supported by Samaa TV and the Government of Punjab, kicked off with vibrant cultural performances at the Alhamra Arts Centre in Lahore.The festival, which will run until November 17, showcases the diverse cultural heritage of Pakistan. The opening day featured an array of traditional dance performances from the Punjabi, Sindhi, Balochi, and Pakhtun regions, offering a colorful glimpse into the country's rich cultural tapestry. Sufi performances captivated the audience during the initial session, followed by special appearances from actress Sawira Nadeem and Indian poet Arvindar Singh Chamka. A highlight of the event was Ajoka's presentation of Dara, a theatrical piece exploring the Mughal era, which left the audience enthralled. The festival witnessed full participation from art-loving Pakistanis, who lauded the remarkable performances by the artists. The ongoing festival continues to celebrate the artistic spirit and unity of the region, fostering stronger cultural ties between Pakistan and India.

Title: Kinza Hashmi mirrors glamour in fresh snaps
Content: Pakistani actress Kinza Hashmi has undoubtedly proved her mettle on many accounts, whether it be her acting prowess or mesmerising content on the social media platforms. Taking to Instagram, the “Ishq Tamasha” star had dropped a brand new set of snaps in which she is seen posing for the clicks in a boisterous fashion and stealing the spotlight in no time. For the clicks, she captioned: “Lost in the chaos, found in the vibes.” A post shared by Kinza Hashmi (@kinzahashmi)  Fans started to pen their sentiments by dropping plenty of emoticons and penning statements. In the comments box, one of the followers wrote, “You look gorgeous and glamorous.” Due to her unwavering commitment to her profession, Kinza is inch closer to garnering 10 million followers on her Instagram handle.

Title: Canada ends fast processing of international student visas
Content: In a recent policy shift affecting international students applying to study in Canada, Ottawa has announced the immediate termination of the Student Direct Stream (SDS) program. The Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) issued a statement on Friday explaining that the SDS initiative, which was launched in 2018, aimed to “provide faster processing for eligible post-secondary students” and had expanded to include applicants from 14 countries, such as India. The IRCC stated that Canada’s goal is to “strengthen program integrity, address student vulnerability, and ensure equal and fair access for all applicants,” which has led to the SDS closure as of November 8. Previously, SDS allowed for faster study permit processing times with higher approval rates for qualified applicants. Going forward, applications will be processed under the regular stream. According to Naresh Chavda, the president of Globayan Immigration Corporation, the SDS program initially catered to students from India and China, then expanded to other countries, offering a simplified evaluation process for those meeting language and financial criteria along with a letter of acceptance from a Canadian institution. Under SDS, permits were processed within four weeks -- half the time taken in the regular stream -- and had a 95% approval rate. Chavda remarked, “They’ve closed a program designed to attract students, likely to limit the intake of international students.” The decision may impact student interest in Canada, potentially shifting it to other destinations. Meanwhile, IRCC set a target for study permits in 2025 at 437,000, down from 485,000 in 2024, and this stabilized number will also apply in 2026. IRCC has been implementing changes related to international students since late last year. On December 7, it announced that new study permit applications from January 2024 onward must show financial proof of CA$20,635, up from CA$10,000. Further, beginning in December 2023, designated learning institutions (DLIs) will be required to verify each applicant's acceptance letter through IRCC.

Title: Actor Athiya Shetty, cricketer KL Rahul announce first pregnancy
Content: Actor Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul are expecting their first child in 2025, as the couple joyfully announced on Friday. They shared the news with fans on Instagram, posting a heartfelt note that read, “Our beautiful blessing is coming soon. 2025,” accompanied by visuals of tiny baby feet and an evil eye charm. Athiya added a white heart emoji to the announcement, sparking warm responses from friends, family, and industry colleagues in the comments. A post shared by Athiya Shetty (@athiyashetty)  Rumours of Athiya’s pregnancy initially surfaced in April when her father, actor Suniel Shetty, made a playful “nana” (grandfather) comment on a dance reality show. At the time, a source clarified that there was no truth to the speculation, noting that Suniel’s remark had been taken out of context. KL Rahul and Athiya’s relationship began in 2019 after they met through a mutual friend. The couple tied the knot in 2023 at Suniel’s Khandala farmhouse, surrounded by close family and friends. Announcing their wedding, they shared, “In your light, I learn how to love… Today, with our most loved ones, we got married in the home that’s given us immense joy and serenity. With a heart full of gratitude and love, we seek your blessings on this journey of togetherness” Since then, Athiya and KL Rahul have continued to post sweet moments together on social media, now looking forward to welcoming a new chapter in their lives.

Title: Pakistani singer Arooj Aftab gets two 2025 Grammy nominations
Content: Pakistani-American singer Arooj Aftab has once again secured Grammy nominations for the upcoming awards ceremony in 2025. This year, her song 'Raat Ki Rani' earned a nomination in the Best Global Music Performance category. The song features on her album 'Night Reign', which has itself received recognition in the Best Alternative Jazz Album category. A post shared by Arooj Aftab (@aroojaftab)  Aftab made history in 2022 as the first Pakistani woman to win a Grammy, taking home the inaugural award for Best Global Music Performance with her song 'Mohabbat'. She was also nominated for Best New Artist that year, though the award went to singer-songwriter Olivia Rodrigo. Additionally, she performed her Grammy-nominated track *Usher Na* with Anoushka Shankar at the premier ceremony. Aftab, 37, has lived in New York for nearly 15 years, steadily gaining global acclaim for her unique fusion of Sufi traditions with folk, jazz, and minimalism. Beyoncé has emerged as the frontrunner for the 2025 Grammy Awards, securing 11 nominations, which brings her career total to 99 -- the highest number in Grammy history. Her country-inspired album 'Cowboy Carter' is nominated for both Album of the Year and Country Album of the Year, while her hit 'Texas Hold ’Em' has earned nods for Record, Song, and Country Song of the Year. This marks Beyoncé's debut in the country and Americana categories, making it a groundbreaking year for her. Previously, Beyoncé and her husband Jay-Z were tied with 88 career nominations each. Now, she stands alone at the top. Should she win Album of the Year, she would be the first Black woman to take home the award in the 21st century; the last was Lauryn Hill in 1999 with 'The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill'. Post Malone also received his first Grammy nominations in the country genre this year, thanks to his August release 'F-1 Trillion'. The album is up for Country Album of the Year, and his collaboration with Morgan Wallen, 'I Had Some Help', is nominated for Country Song and Country Duo/Group Performance. These are Wallen’s first Grammy nominations as well. Behind Beyoncé, Malone is tied for the second-most nominations this year with Billie Eilish, Kendrick Lamar, and Charli XCX, each of whom earned seven. Lamar’s high-profile diss track 'Not Like Us' garnered nominations in multiple categories, including Record of the Year, Song of the Year, Rap Song, Music Video, and Best Rap Performance. He also achieved a career milestone with two simultaneous entries in the Best Rap Performance category, a first for him. Taylor Swift, along with first-time nominees Sabrina Carpenter and Chappell Roan, received six nominations each. Swift's nomination for 'The Tortured Poets Department' adds to her record-breaking streak in the Album of the Year category, where she has won four times. This year, she also makes history with seven career nominations in the category -- the most by any female artist. Album of the Year nominations reflect a diverse range of genres, with entries from André 3000’s alt-jazz album 'New Blue Sun', Jacob Collier’s 'Djesse Vol. 4', and pop newcomers Carpenter and Roan with 'Short n’ Sweet' and *The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess', respectively. Other nominees include Eilish’s 'Hit Me Hard and Soft' and Charli XCX’s 'BRAT', making this year one of varied musical representation.

Content: Beyoncé has emerged as the frontrunner for the 2025 Grammy Awards, securing 11 nominations, which brings her career total to 99 -- the highest number in Grammy history. Her country-inspired album 'Cowboy Carter' is nominated for both Album of the Year and Country Album of the Year, while her hit 'Texas Hold ’Em' has earned nods for Record, Song, and Country Song of the Year. This marks Beyoncé's debut in the country and Americana categories, making it a groundbreaking year for her. Previously, Beyoncé and her husband Jay-Z were tied with 88 career nominations each. Now, she stands alone at the top. Should she win Album of the Year, she would be the first Black woman to take home the award in the 21st century; the last was Lauryn Hill in 1999 with 'The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill'. Post Malone also received his first Grammy nominations in the country genre this year, thanks to his August release 'F-1 Trillion'. The album is up for Country Album of the Year, and his collaboration with Morgan Wallen, 'I Had Some Help', is nominated for Country Song and Country Duo/Group Performance. These are Wallen’s first Grammy nominations as well. Behind Beyoncé, Malone is tied for the second-most nominations this year with Billie Eilish, Kendrick Lamar, and Charli XCX, each of whom earned seven. Lamar’s high-profile diss track 'Not Like Us' garnered nominations in multiple categories, including Record of the Year, Song of the Year, Rap Song, Music Video, and Best Rap Performance. He also achieved a career milestone with two simultaneous entries in the Best Rap Performance category, a first for him. Taylor Swift, along with first-time nominees Sabrina Carpenter and Chappell Roan, received six nominations each. Swift's nomination for 'The Tortured Poets Department' adds to her record-breaking streak in the Album of the Year category, where she has won four times. This year, she also makes history with seven career nominations in the category -- the most by any female artist. Album of the Year nominations reflect a diverse range of genres, with entries from André 3000’s alt-jazz album 'New Blue Sun', Jacob Collier’s 'Djesse Vol. 4', and pop newcomers Carpenter and Roan with 'Short n’ Sweet' and *The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess', respectively. Other nominees include Eilish’s 'Hit Me Hard and Soft' and Charli XCX’s 'BRAT', making this year one of varied musical representation. Recording Academy CEO Harvey Mason Jr expressed excitement over the range of genres in this year’s nominations, attributing it to an increasingly diverse voting body. He noted that the Academy has been intentional in rebalancing its membership to include not only gender and racial diversity but also a wider array of genres and regional representation.

Title: Iqra Aziz pays birthday tribute to her mother
Content: Noted actress Iqra Aziz has proved her acting prowess on many accounts and also captivated the attention of fans in no time. She recently paid tribute to her mother on the occasion of her birthday. The “Ranjha Ranjha Kardi” actress had shared a set of snaps in which she is seen capturing some “golden” memories with her mother. The diva has given a strong message to her fans to respect their mothers. A post shared by IQRA AZIZ HUSSAIN🇵🇰 (@iiqraaziz)  For the clicks, she captioned, “Happiest Birthday to my Amma. A day well spent.” Iqra had used the emoticons to further describe love for her mother. Fans went to extend birthday greetings to Iqra’s mother. One of the fans complimented both Iqra and her mother, saying, “Cutest mother-daughter duo.” Due to her unwavering commitment to her profession, Iqra has amassed over 11.3 million followers on her Instagram handle.

Title: Sidhu Moosewala's parents share first photo of his baby brother
Content: Balkaur Singh and Charan Kaur, the parents of late Punjabi rapper Sidhu Moosewala, welcomed a baby boy on March 17, 2024. Recently, they shared the first photo of their eight-month-old son on social media. On Thursday, they posted a heartfelt family picture on Instagram, accompanied by one of Sidhu Moosewala's songs. The caption, written in Punjabi, expressed their emotions: “There is a unique depth in those eyes, one that understands every truth of our lives. Beyond the innocence of the face and beyond words, there is a precious radiance, always making us feel that the face we had once entrusted to the Divine with tearful eyes has now returned to us in a small form, blessed by the grace of the Divine and the prayers of all brothers and sisters. We will forever remain indebted to Waheguru for His immense blessings upon us (sic).” A post shared by Sidhu Moosewala (ਮੂਸੇ ਆਲਾ) (@sidhu_moosewala)  The post also included a video introducing their son, Shubhdeep, along with a series of photos. In the video, Balkaur, Charan, and Sidhu can be seen, with one touching image showing Shubhdeep smiling while sitting in his parents' laps. Sidhu Moosewala, whose full name was Shubhdeep Singh Sidhu, tragically passed away on May 29, 2022, at the age of 28 in Jawaharke village, Mansa district, Punjab. Also Read: Sidhu Moose Wala parents welcome baby boy, know the name Nearly two years after his death, Sidhu’s parents surprised fans by announcing Charan’s pregnancy. His 60-year-old father Balkaur Singh announced the birth of his second son on Instagram, saying that everyone in the family was well. He also shared the picture of the newborn with the portrait of his late son. "With the blessings of millions of souls who love Shubdeep, the Almighty has put Shubh's younger brother in our group. With the blessings of Wahe Guru, the family is healthy and thankful to all the well-wishers for their immense love," the caption read. Earlier this year, her brother-in-law Chamkaur Singh said that the singer's mother, Charan Kaur, was pregnant through In-Vitro Fertilization (IVF).

Title: Indian TV actor Nitin Chauhaan 'dies by suicide'
Content: Indian television actor Nitin Chauhaan, best known for his win on the reality show 'Dadagiri 2', allegedly died by suicide on Thursday in Mumbai at the age of 35. His 'Tera Yaar Hoon Main' co-stars, Sudeep Sahir and Sayantani Ghosh, confirmed the tragic news, though they did not share much detail. Nitin’s father reportedly travelled to Mumbai to make arrangements for his last rites. Originally from Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh, Nitin rose to fame with his 'Dadagiri 2' victory and went on to appear in several popular television shows. His credits include 'MTV's Splitsvilla 5', and episodic roles in series like 'Zindagi Dot Com', 'Crime Patrol', and 'Friends'. He was last seen on television in 'Tera Yaar Hoon Main' in 2022. The news of Nitin's untimely death has left his colleagues and fans in shock. Sudeep Sahir paid tribute to him on Instagram, sharing, “Rest in peace, buddy.”  Actress Vibhuti Thakur also mourned his loss, posting a picture with Nitin along with the message, "Rest in peace, my dear. I'm really shocked and sad. I wish you had the strength to face all the troubles. I wish you were mentally strong like your body."  While speaking to the media, Nitin’s friend Kuldeep shared, “We came to know today morning when his father and sister called us revealing that Nitin had passed away and they mentioned that the cause of death was suicide. We are equally shocked as he was going to come next month to Delhi and we had plans of going to Khatu Shyam ji’s temple together.” He added, “Right now we are sitting with his family here, his father has come to Mumbai to bring his mortal remains to Delhi. We are also waiting for him to come here. Uncle’s flight is at 10 pm so mostly by 4-5 am they will arrive. Last month, Nitin had made plans to go to Rajasthan and he would be here every few months. He has been our life, we have so many memories with him. For all our trips, Nitin would make sure that he drove us and kept us comfortable.”

Title: Yumna Zaidi embraces pink colour
Content: Pakistani actress Yumna Zaidi is undoubtedly one of the most established names of the showbiz industry, having proved her mettle with versatile acting prowess. Taking to Instagram, the “Zara Yaad Kar” actress posted fresh photos in an energetic fashion. In the clicks, she is seen donning a pinkish outfit. The plus points of the photos are their unique style of posing. Each of the photos had its own flair. In one of the clicks, she is seen holding the book, named “The Waris Shah’s Heer”. For the clicks, she captioned: “Today’s wellness was Pink.” A post shared by Yumna Zaidi (@yumnazaidiofficial)  Fans were absolutely swooned and went on to drop plenty of feedback in the comments section. One of the users wrote, "Gorgeous." Another of the users had also praised the starlet and went on to drop a variety of emoticons. Due to her unwavering commitment to her profession, Yumna had bagged over 9.4 million followers on her Instagram handle.

Title: Suniel Shetty injured seriously during web series shoot
Content: Veteran actor Suniel Shetty sustained a serious injury while filming an action sequence for his upcoming web series Hunter in Mumbai. The incident occurred during an intense fight scene involving several action performers, where a wooden log prop was accidentally mishandled. The sequence, designed to showcase Shetty’s renowned commitment to performing his own stunts, took a dangerous turn when the log struck him directly in the rib cage. Sources close to the development revealed that the impact caused significant pain, prompting immediate medical attention on set. Despite his long-standing reputation for executing high-intensity action sequences, Shetty’s injury appeared to be severe enough to raise concerns among the cast and crew. A doctor was quickly called to the scene, and an X-ray machine was brought in to assess the extent of the damage. Fortunately, the X-ray results have not shown any fractures or internal injuries, though the full implications of the injury are still being evaluated. Shetty, who is well-known for his dedication to performing stunts with authenticity and precision, has always pushed the boundaries of action filmmaking. His commitment to physically demanding roles has earned him a loyal fan base and respect within the industry. However, this incident has served as a stark reminder of the inherent risks associated with action filmmaking. The actor, who is also gearing up for the release of Welcome to the Jungle alongside Akshay Kumar and Paresh Rawal, is expected to take time to recover from the injury.

Title: 'It was my mistake': Nadia Khan opens up about her first marriage
Content: Famous actress, model, and TV host Nadia Khan opened up about her first marriage during a recent appearance on a private TV morning show, admitting that her decision to marry at the age of 20 was a mistake driven by stubbornness and ego. Khan, known for her successful career in the entertainment industry, confessed that despite her parents' repeated warnings, she rushed into marriage without considering the long-term consequences. “At the time, I was young, impulsive, and unaware. I married out of stubbornness and ego,” she shared candidly during the interview. She revealed that her career was flourishing, and everything seemed to be falling into place, yet she chose to marry against her parents’ wishes."My parents kept telling me to wait, but I didn’t listen. I made the decision, and I alone am responsible for it," she said. Reflecting on her mother's premonition, Khan recalled how her mother had dreamt that the marriage would not end well, a prediction that, sadly, came true. "She had a dream that my marriage wouldn't work, but I didn’t pay heed to her words. I lived through fear and anxiety during that time," Nadia admitted. The actress emphasised that while many of her peers at the time were getting married, she did not have the experience or understanding needed to make such an important decision. "Girls my age were either already married or in relationships, but I had never experienced such things, so I made this decision out of spite," she added. Although admitting that her first marriage was a mistake, Khan did acknowledge the positive outcome of having two children from that union, which she described as a beautiful gift. "Despite the failure of my first marriage, I gained two wonderful children, and they made my life beautiful," she said with gratitude. Nadia Khan also spoke about the harsh reality that love alone does not guarantee a successful marriage. "Falling in love doesn’t automatically mean that the marriage will work. Married life is an entirely different experience," she explained, offering a valuable lesson to those in similar situations. The actress’s first marriage took place in the 1990s, and although she immediately realized it was a mistake, she continued the marriage for ten years. She also revealed that she has a daughter from her first marriage, who is now over 20 years old, and a 15-year-old son. Khan later married Faisal Rao in January 2021, marking her third marriage. Both her first two marriages ended in divorce, and her third husband's first marriage also ended in divorce.Despite the challenges, Nadia Khan has remained a prominent figure in Pakistan’s entertainment industry, continuing her career as a beloved TV host and actress.

Title: Mahira Khan honoured by UK Parliament for contribution to arts
Content: Mahira Khan, one of Pakistan’s biggest stars, began her career as a VJ and quickly rose to fame with the hit drama 'Humsafar'. Since then, she has delivered numerous popular dramas and films, along with hosting a few shows. Known for her international success, Mahira has proudly represented Pakistan on the global stage. A post shared by Murtaza ali shah (@murtazaviews)  Currently, she is in London shooting for 'Love Guru', a film starring Humayun Saeed. During her stay, Mahira was honoured by the UK Parliament for her contributions to the arts and her role as a global cultural ambassador, marking yet another moment of pride for Pakistan.  This achievement was also acknowledged by the Pakistan High Commission in London. Spouse of the High Commissioner of Pakistan to UK, Dr. Sarah Naeem @drsarahnaeem2 participated in a gathering hosted by Afzal Khan MP @AfzalKhanMCR at the @UKParliament to honor Pakistan's renowned films artist Mahira Khan @TheMahiraKhan in #London.“Through hard work,… pic.twitter.com/5xlPuwqoII  Taking to her Instagram account, Mahira Khan shared a picture of the award on her stories and expressed gratitude over the recognition.

Title: After Salman Khan, Shah Rukh Khan also receives death threat
Content: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan has received a death threat via phone call, prompting the registration of a case at Bandra Police Station in Mumbai. The threat allegedly came from Faizan, a resident of Raipur, Chhattisgarh. The call was made to the Bandra Police Station's landline on November 5. Following the incident, a Mumbai Police team has been dispatched to Raipur to investigate further. Indian media sources say the caller threatened to harm the Bollywood superstar if several crores weren't paid as ransom. “Bandra police station received a call threatening Shah Rukh Khan and asking for five million INR. An offence has been registered. No arrest has been made yet,” a senior police official said. A case has been filed against an unidentified individual at Bandra Police Station under sections 308(4) and 351(3)(4) BNS. Details of the case are still awaited. Shah Rukh Khan has been under heightened security for some time, particularly after receiving death threats in 2023 following the success of his films 'Pathaan' and 'Jawan'. In October 2023, he was granted Y+ security, and his protection has been a priority ever since. It was reported that Shah Rukh opted not to greet fans outside his Mumbai residence, Mannat, on his birthday this year due to security concerns, though his team did not confirm or deny the rumors. The actor has not yet publicly commented on the recent death threat. Shah Rukh is not the only Bollywood star facing such threats. His close friend, Salman Khan, has also been targeted by threats, particularly in relation to his involvement in the blackbuck poaching case. Recently, Salman received a death threat from gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's gang, prompting an increase in his security. Salman has been provided Y+ security as well. These threats come in the wake of the murder of political leader Baba Siddique, for which a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang claimed responsibility. The gang also issued threats against Salman Khan in the same statement. Both stars, along with the Mumbai Police, are taking extra precautions to ensure their safety.

Title: Tuba Anwar opens up about ideal partner qualities
Content: Actress and former TV producer Tuba Anwar, who rose to prominence after her brief marriage to the late televangelist Aamir Liaquat Hussain, has shared insights into her personal preferences regarding an ideal partner.Anwar, now a celebrated actress, has made her mark in the industry with notable roles, including her current appearance in Baby Baji Ki Bahuein. During a recent guest appearance on Samaa TV's show "Gap Shab" hosted by Vasay Chaudhary, Tuba opened up about her inspirations, career, and what she seeks in a life partner. When asked about the qualities she envisions in an ideal man, she emphasised substance, intellect, and kindness as core attributes. "The ideal man should have depth in his personality and be capable of engaging in intellectual conversations," Anwar shared, adding that a good heart is equally essential.She further noted with a smile that a height of at least 6’2” would also be a welcome trait.

Title: Kartik Aaryan reveals he’s single: 'Didn’t have time to date'
Content: Kartik Aaryan is enjoying professional success this Diwali season with his latest release, 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3', performing well at theaters across India. The actor has been on a busy streak with back-to-back major projects, including 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' and 'Chandu Champion', which has left him little time for personal life — or dating, as he recently shared. In a chat with Mashable India, Kartik confirmed that he’s single and doesn’t use any dating apps, citing his intense work schedule as the reason. “I am single. I don’t have to send my live location to anyone. I am not even present in any dating applications. Technically, since the time I have been preparing and shooting for Chandu Champion, I didn’t get the time.” He added that his busy prep and filming for 'Chandu Champion', where he portrays boxer-turned-para swimmer Murlikant Petkar, has kept him occupied. “I was in such a strict regimen, in which I had to calculate my gym, eating, and sleeping pattern, just like an athlete. All of that went on for two years. In fact, I was also learning swimming for the very first time. The routine became so hectic. Plus, shooting for 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' and finishing it in a specific period of time was also a challenge. So, I was completely busy with all that." Released on the Diwali weekend, 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' has been a commercial hit, collecting over 150 crore INR globally in its first weekend and maintaining strong performance. In India, it earned 17.50 crore INR net on Monday, bringing its four-day domestic total to 123.50 crore INR, while overseas, it grossed over ₹30 crore during the opening weekend.

Title: US election: Katy Perry to rally in Pittsburgh for Harris-Walz campaign
Content: Grammy-nominated artist Katy Perry is set to make an appearance today in Pittsburgh to support Vice President Kamala Harris and her running mate, Tim Walz, as the 2024 presidential election looms closer. Perry’s participation at this high-profile rally is part of a broader “Get Out the Vote” effort aimed at mobilising young voters and first-time voters across key swing states, with Pennsylvania at the centre of this push. Perry, a well-known advocate for social justice and progressive causes, is expected to add energy and star power to the Pittsburgh event. "Our focus is on bringing people together and energising those who have the power to shape our future," Perry shared in a statement. Her involvement underscores the Harris-Walz campaign's strategy to engage key demographics ahead of Election Day. This rally is one of several across Pennsylvania on November 4, where Perry’s influence will be paralleled by a star-studded lineup at a separate rally in Philadelphia. The Philadelphia event will feature powerhouse names such as Lady Gaga, Oprah Winfrey, Jazmine Sullivan, the Roots, Fat Joe, Freeway, Just Blaze, DJ Jazzy Jeff, Adam Blackstone, and DJ Cassidy. According to the Harris-Walz campaign, "Our aim is to inspire and remind voters of the crucial role they play in determining our nation’s path." By drawing in prominent entertainers, the campaign hopes to galvanise support in Pennsylvania—a pivotal battleground state that could influence the 2024 election outcome.

Title: ‘Kabhi Main Kabhi Tum’ finale confuses fans: Bonus episode tease?
Content: Pakistani drama “Kabhi Main Kabhi Tum” has captivated audiences nationwide, leaving viewers eager yet uncertain about the release date of its final episode. Produced by Fahad Mustafa and written by Farhat Ishtiaq, the drama has drawn massive fanfare across Pakistan and internationally, with Fahad Mustafa making a powerful comeback in a lead role after a ten-year hiatus. Rumours have been swirling on social media about when fans will see the long-awaited finale, especially regarding the fate of characters Sharjeena and Mustafa. Speculations were rife that the last episode would premiere in cinemas on November 5. A post shared by ARY Digital (@arydigital.tv)  However, the channel’s recent Instagram post hinted at a new episode airing on Monday night, adding to fans’ curiosity. Adding to the intrigue, Fahad Mustafa recently hinted on his game show that the finale would indeed hit theatres, with tickets already sold out across cinemas nationwide. He added that if the response is overwhelming, the final episode might be extended for a week in theatres. This double announcement has fans questioning if a “mega episode” will screen on Monday or if it’s a recap to lead into the anticipated cinema finale. Viewers are now eagerly awaiting further details from the channel.

Title: Aima Baig sparks romance rumours with designer Zain Ahmad
Content: Singer Aima Baig is once again making headlines on social media, but this time, it’s her personal life sparking the buzz. Amid her ongoing dispute with fellow singer Sarah Raza Khan, Aima has hinted at a budding romance by sharing a cosy Instagram photo with designer Zain Ahmad, also known as Zainoo. The photo, taken in Rome, Italy, featured a plate adorned with the words "I Love You" and a candle shaped like a flower, capturing a moment that quickly stirred fans. A post shared by DIVA Magazine Pakistan (@divamagazinepakistan)  Dressed in a red outfit, Aima’s post read, "Never felt this special before," while Zain sported a sleek black suit. The couple’s appearance has sparked excitement among fans, who had already been speculating on their relationship over the past two months. Rumours had initially taken off when Aima shared multiple pictures with Zain on social media, fuelling curiosity about their connection. This recent post marks a new chapter for Aima, who was previously engaged to actor Shahbaz Shigri. The couple ended their engagement and announced the news publicly on social media. As discussions around her relationship with Zain continue to spread, fans eagerly await any official updates. A post shared by Zain Ahmad (@zainoo_95)  Zain Ahmad is a Lahore-based entrepreneur who founded Rastah, an urban brand celebrating South Asian culture through contemporary streetwear. Since its inception in 2018, Rastah has gained international acclaim, with features in Vogue and celebrity clients like Zayn Malik, Bollywood director Karan Johar, rapper French Montana, and Oscar-winning actor Riz Ahmed.

Title: Shah Rukh Khan reveals he's quit smoking
Content: On his birthday, Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan surprised fans with the revelation that he has quit smoking. The actor, who once admitted to smoking up to 100 cigarettes a day, shared this news during a meet-and-greet event on Saturday. In a video posted by the fan page Shah Rukh Khan Universe, SRK is seen announcing to a thrilled crowd, "There's a good thing - I'm not smoking anymore, guys." Reflecting on his decision, the 'Dunki' star humorously noted that he expected to feel less breathless after quitting but admitted that he’s still adjusting to the change. "Mujhe laga tha ki I will not feel so breathless, but abhi bhi feel kar raha hoon (I thought I wouldn't feel breathless after quitting smoking, but I still do)," Khan said, acknowledging the adjustment period. He remained optimistic, saying, "Inshallah, woh bhi theek ho jayega (By God's grace, that will also be fine)." A post shared by Shah Rukh Khan Universe (@srkuniversefc)  Shah Rukh received touching birthday tributes from his family. His daughter Suhana Khan shared a nostalgic photo collage on social media, featuring vintage black-and-white pictures of SRK playing with his children Aryan and Suhana. "Happy Birthday (heart emoji). Love you the most in the world." she captioned one of the images. His wife, Gauri Khan, shared a glimpse of the birthday celebration with family and friends. In a heart-warming photo, SRK is seen cutting his birthday cake with Gauri and Suhana by his side. "A memorable evening last night with friends and family... happy birthday," she captioned the post. Several Bollywood celebrities, including Kareena Kapoor, Ananya Panday, Kamal Haasan, Farah Khan, and Vicky Kaushal, also extended their warm wishes to Shah Rukh on his 59th birthday.

Title: Esra Bilgic mirrors glamour in uber-cool snaps
Content: Turkish actress Esra Bilgic, who is not only known for her acting prowess but also for her mesmerising content on social media. Plus, talking in terms of the localisation, Bilgic had gained massive popularity in Pakistan during the COVID-19, when the Turkish historical drama series, 'Dirilis: Ertugrul' stole the spotlight in the country. Taking to Instagram, Bilgic dropped a fresh set of snaps to leave her dedicated followers awestruck. In the photo, she is seen beaming up with joy, putting up a blackish top. The way she flashes a smile, it takes the clicks to another level. A post shared by Esra Bilgic (@esbilgic)  The fans were desperate to praise the starlet in various ways. Some of them penned lengthy feedback, while others used multiple emoticons to compliment the Turkish diva. Bilgic’s Instagram platform has continued to witness growth, with the actress garnering 7.6 million followers on the handle.

Title: Kriti Sanon celebrates Diwali with verve
Content: Bollywood diva Kriti Sanon has established herself as one of the most prolific actresses and garnered millions of followers due to her unwavering commitment to her profession. Sanon has recently celebrated Diwali with verve and joy along with her friends and family. Taking to Instagram, Sanon dropped a set of pictures in which she is seen beaming with joy in Diwali. For the photos, she captioned the post: “Diwali with family and friends.Happy Diwali, everyone.” Fans were desperate to pen their feedback and ensure to share the happiness of Diwali with their celebrated actress. A post shared by Kriti (@kritisanon)  The “Bhediya” star had amassed over 58million followers on her Instagram handle.

Title: Legendary Indian fashion designer Rohit Bal dies at 63
Content: Renowned Indian fashion designer Rohit Bal has passed away at the age of 63. According to Indian media reports, Bal was admitted to the ICU a week prior to his final show in October. After being discharged, he was admitted again to Aashlok Hospital in Delhi on Wednesday, where he suffered a cardiac arrest and passed away on Friday. The Fashion Design Council of India (FDCI) paid tribute to Bal, fondly known as 'Gudda', in an Instagram post, honouring his impact on Indian fashion. "We mourn the passing of Legendary designer Rohit Bal. He was a founding member of the Fashion Design Council of India (FDCI). Known for his unique blend of traditional patterns with modern sensibilities, Bal's work redefined Indian fashion, and inspired generations. His legacy of artistry, and innovation along with forward thinking will live on in the fashion world. Rest in peace GUDDA," the council wrote. FDCI President Sunil Sethi confirmed that Bal’s cremation would take place on Saturday, stating, "It's true that he has passed away. He had a cardiac arrest... heart failure. Rohit was a legend, we are completely shaken right now. We are trying to work out details for the cremation tomorrow." Born in Srinagar, Bal began his career in 1986, eventually becoming one of the most celebrated names in Indian fashion. His accolades include ‘Designer of the Year’ at the Indian Fashion Awards in 2006 and the Kingfisher Fashion Achievement Award in 2001. He was also the Lakme Grand Finale Designer in 2012. Recently, after overcoming health challenges, Bal returned to the runway at the Lakme Fashion Week X FDCI grand finale, showcasing his collection "Kaaynaat: A Bloom in the Universe," with actress Ananya Panday as the showstopper in one of his signature pieces.

Title: Shah Rukh Khan shines in luxury look, sports 5 crore INR watch
Content: Shah Rukh Khan brought serious style to IIFA 2024, proving once again that age is just a number for Bollywood's King Khan. His sophisticated look was enhanced by an impressive selection of accessories, particularly his luxury watch and jewellery. A post shared by Shah Rukh Khan’s Wardrobe (@srkswardrobe)  Known for his appreciation of high-end timepieces, Shah Rukh wore an Audemars Piguet Royal Oak Double Balance Wheel Openworked watch, a masterpiece in 41mm 18-carat rose gold with a gem-set bezel that combines elegance with bold design. This iconic watch, model number 15412OR.RR.1220OR.01, is highly sought after among luxury watch collectors, priced at an impressive 4.6 crore INR. A post shared by Pooja Dadlani Gurnani (@poojadadlani02)  Shah Rukh's manager, Pooja Dadlani, shared photos of him on Instagram with the caption, "The perfect host looking sharp as ever… a magical evening at @iifa awards!" In the pictures, SRK looked striking in a brown satin shirt with open buttons, layered under a rust-toned, glossy black blazer with rolled-up sleeves for a modern twist. He completed the look with tailored dark green trousers, a bronze belt, a layered gold necklace by Sabyasachi, brown loafers, perfectly styled hair, and a neatly trimmed beard. On the work front, Shah Rukh Khan is gearing up for the release of 'Mufasa: The Lion King', where he lends his voice to the Hindi version of the film. He is also working on an action-packed project titled 'King', where he stars alongside his daughter Suhana Khan and Abhishek Bachchan.

Title: Actor Athiya Shetty, cricketer KL Rahul announce first pregnancy
Content: Actor Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul are expecting their first child in 2025, as the couple joyfully announced on Friday. They shared the news with fans on Instagram, posting a heartfelt note that read, “Our beautiful blessing is coming soon. 2025,” accompanied by visuals of tiny baby feet and an evil eye charm. Athiya added a white heart emoji to the announcement, sparking warm responses from friends, family, and industry colleagues in the comments. A post shared by Athiya Shetty (@athiyashetty)  Rumours of Athiya’s pregnancy initially surfaced in April when her father, actor Suniel Shetty, made a playful “nana” (grandfather) comment on a dance reality show. At the time, a source clarified that there was no truth to the speculation, noting that Suniel’s remark had been taken out of context. KL Rahul and Athiya’s relationship began in 2019 after they met through a mutual friend. The couple tied the knot in 2023 at Suniel’s Khandala farmhouse, surrounded by close family and friends. Announcing their wedding, they shared, “In your light, I learn how to love… Today, with our most loved ones, we got married in the home that’s given us immense joy and serenity. With a heart full of gratitude and love, we seek your blessings on this journey of togetherness” Since then, Athiya and KL Rahul have continued to post sweet moments together on social media, now looking forward to welcoming a new chapter in their lives.

Title: Sidhu Moosewala's parents share first photo of his baby brother
Content: Balkaur Singh and Charan Kaur, the parents of late Punjabi rapper Sidhu Moosewala, welcomed a baby boy on March 17, 2024. Recently, they shared the first photo of their eight-month-old son on social media. On Thursday, they posted a heartfelt family picture on Instagram, accompanied by one of Sidhu Moosewala's songs. The caption, written in Punjabi, expressed their emotions: “There is a unique depth in those eyes, one that understands every truth of our lives. Beyond the innocence of the face and beyond words, there is a precious radiance, always making us feel that the face we had once entrusted to the Divine with tearful eyes has now returned to us in a small form, blessed by the grace of the Divine and the prayers of all brothers and sisters. We will forever remain indebted to Waheguru for His immense blessings upon us (sic).” A post shared by Sidhu Moosewala (ਮੂਸੇ ਆਲਾ) (@sidhu_moosewala)  The post also included a video introducing their son, Shubhdeep, along with a series of photos. In the video, Balkaur, Charan, and Sidhu can be seen, with one touching image showing Shubhdeep smiling while sitting in his parents' laps. Sidhu Moosewala, whose full name was Shubhdeep Singh Sidhu, tragically passed away on May 29, 2022, at the age of 28 in Jawaharke village, Mansa district, Punjab. Also Read: Sidhu Moose Wala parents welcome baby boy, know the name Nearly two years after his death, Sidhu’s parents surprised fans by announcing Charan’s pregnancy. His 60-year-old father Balkaur Singh announced the birth of his second son on Instagram, saying that everyone in the family was well. He also shared the picture of the newborn with the portrait of his late son. "With the blessings of millions of souls who love Shubdeep, the Almighty has put Shubh's younger brother in our group. With the blessings of Wahe Guru, the family is healthy and thankful to all the well-wishers for their immense love," the caption read. Earlier this year, her brother-in-law Chamkaur Singh said that the singer's mother, Charan Kaur, was pregnant through In-Vitro Fertilization (IVF).

Title: Indian TV actor Nitin Chauhaan 'dies by suicide'
Content: Indian television actor Nitin Chauhaan, best known for his win on the reality show 'Dadagiri 2', allegedly died by suicide on Thursday in Mumbai at the age of 35. His 'Tera Yaar Hoon Main' co-stars, Sudeep Sahir and Sayantani Ghosh, confirmed the tragic news, though they did not share much detail. Nitin’s father reportedly travelled to Mumbai to make arrangements for his last rites. Originally from Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh, Nitin rose to fame with his 'Dadagiri 2' victory and went on to appear in several popular television shows. His credits include 'MTV's Splitsvilla 5', and episodic roles in series like 'Zindagi Dot Com', 'Crime Patrol', and 'Friends'. He was last seen on television in 'Tera Yaar Hoon Main' in 2022. The news of Nitin's untimely death has left his colleagues and fans in shock. Sudeep Sahir paid tribute to him on Instagram, sharing, “Rest in peace, buddy.”  Actress Vibhuti Thakur also mourned his loss, posting a picture with Nitin along with the message, "Rest in peace, my dear. I'm really shocked and sad. I wish you had the strength to face all the troubles. I wish you were mentally strong like your body."  While speaking to the media, Nitin’s friend Kuldeep shared, “We came to know today morning when his father and sister called us revealing that Nitin had passed away and they mentioned that the cause of death was suicide. We are equally shocked as he was going to come next month to Delhi and we had plans of going to Khatu Shyam ji’s temple together.” He added, “Right now we are sitting with his family here, his father has come to Mumbai to bring his mortal remains to Delhi. We are also waiting for him to come here. Uncle’s flight is at 10 pm so mostly by 4-5 am they will arrive. Last month, Nitin had made plans to go to Rajasthan and he would be here every few months. He has been our life, we have so many memories with him. For all our trips, Nitin would make sure that he drove us and kept us comfortable.”

Title: Mahira Khan honoured by UK Parliament for contribution to arts
Content: Mahira Khan, one of Pakistan’s biggest stars, began her career as a VJ and quickly rose to fame with the hit drama 'Humsafar'. Since then, she has delivered numerous popular dramas and films, along with hosting a few shows. Known for her international success, Mahira has proudly represented Pakistan on the global stage. A post shared by Murtaza ali shah (@murtazaviews)  Currently, she is in London shooting for 'Love Guru', a film starring Humayun Saeed. During her stay, Mahira was honoured by the UK Parliament for her contributions to the arts and her role as a global cultural ambassador, marking yet another moment of pride for Pakistan.  This achievement was also acknowledged by the Pakistan High Commission in London. Spouse of the High Commissioner of Pakistan to UK, Dr. Sarah Naeem @drsarahnaeem2 participated in a gathering hosted by Afzal Khan MP @AfzalKhanMCR at the @UKParliament to honor Pakistan's renowned films artist Mahira Khan @TheMahiraKhan in #London.“Through hard work,… pic.twitter.com/5xlPuwqoII  Taking to her Instagram account, Mahira Khan shared a picture of the award on her stories and expressed gratitude over the recognition.

Title: Angelina Jolie welcomes 2024 with stylish statement: Unveils latest fashion upgrade
Content: Angelina Jolie steps into 2024 with a fresh fashion outlook, showcasing a stylish upgrade to her timeless outerwear during her initial public appearance of the year. As reported by Harper's Bazaar, the Maleficent actress dazzled in a jet-black coat adorned with distinctive white patches, each featuring a variety of unique sketches. The classic black coat was further enhanced with golden floral embroidery along the hemline.  The mother of six accessorized the ensemble with sleek black shades and matching leather boots, completing the look as she emerged from her flagship Atelier Jolie store in New York.  In the previous year, Angelina Jolie shared insights with Bazaar about her venture into the fashion world with Atelier Jolie, emphasizing the importance of creating shared moments amidst the divisive nature of the world.
